result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Ohlsson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Any and all sex offender treatment deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with the victim whatsoever by any method or medium.
Register as a Sex Offender for the period of probation only.
Any use or access of computer equipment is to be determined by Agent.
No use or possession of any video or recording devices.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 06:00 p.m. on 06-06-2016.
LAST 60 DAYS ARE STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion.

AS OF 7/29/2016: AMEND TO LAST 65 DAYS ARE STAYED, and to be used at Agent's discretion.
